nodes.documentation:
@title Crowdsale
@dev Crowdsale is a base contract for managing a token crowdsale,
allowing investors to purchase tokens with ether. This contract implements
such functionality in its most fundamental form and can be extended to provide additional
functionality and/or custom behavior.
The external interface represents the basic interface for purchasing tokens, and conform
the base architecture for crowdsales. They are *not* intended to be modified / overridden.
The internal interface conforms the extensible and modifiable surface of crowdsales. Override
the methods to add functionality. Consider using 'super' where appropriate to concatenate
behavior.
nodes.name: Crowdsale
TokensPurchased

nodes.documentation:
@dev fallback function ***DO NOT OVERRIDE***
Note that other contracts will transfer fund with a base gas stipend
of 2300, which is not enough to call buyTokens. Consider calling
buyTokens directly when purchasing tokens from a contract.
@return the token being sold.
nodes.name: token

nodes.documentation: @return the address where funds are collected.
nodes.name: wallet

nodes.documentation: @return the number of token units a buyer gets per wei.
nodes.name: rate

nodes.documentation: @return the amount of wei raised.
nodes.name: weiRaised
buyTokens
_preValidatePurchase
_postValidatePurchase
_deliverTokens
_processPurchase
_updatePurchasingState
_getTokenAmount

nodes.documentation: @dev Determines how ETH is stored/forwarded on purchases.
nodes.name: _forwardFunds

buyTokens(address).details: low level token purchase ***DO NOT OVERRIDE*** This function has a non-reentrancy guard, so it shouldn't be called by another `nonReentrant` function.

rate().return: the number of token units a buyer gets per wei.

wallet().return: the address where funds are collected.
